wlv.mt
Class AbstractFeatureExtractor

java.lang.Object
  wlv.mt.AbstractFeatureExtractor
Direct Known Subclasses:
FeatureExtractor
public abstract class AbstractFeatureExtractor
extends java.lang.Object

AbstractFeatureExtractor is the base class for any FeatureExtractor. It provides implementations for the methods that create the folder structure of the projec and definitions for methods that have to be implemented b subclasses

Author:
Catalina Hallett

parseArguments

public abstract void parseArguments(java.lang.String[] args)
The implementations of this abstract method should handle the command line arguments and retrieve parameters required by the application Since the command line arguments are application specific, this method doesn't have a default implementation

Parameters:
args - The command line arguments

preprocessing

protected void preprocessing()
Performs some basic processing of the input source and target files. The input files are also copied to the /input folder. This is necessary because the some tools (e.g., the MADA morphological analyser) produce their output in the same folder as the input file, which may cause problems if the right access rights are not available for that particular folder

run

public void run()
Runs the Feature Extractor
  • constructs the required folders
  • runs the pre-processing tools
  • runs the BB features, GB features or both according to the command line parameters

runAll

public abstract void runAll()

constructFolders

public void constructFolders()
constructs the folders required by the application. These are, typically:
  • /input and subfolders
    • /input/sourceLang, /input/targetLang (for storing the results of processing the input files with various tools, such as pos tagger, transliterator, morphological analyser),
    • /input/systems/systemName (for storing system specific resources - for example, the compiled and processed word lattices in the case of the IBM system
  • /output (for storing the resulting feature files),
Subclasses can override this method to construct, for example, subfolders of the systems folder for each available MT system, or temporary folders

runBB

public abstract void runBB()
runs the BB features

runGB

public abstract void runGB()
runs the GB features
